title: Stephen Nolan reveals his own 'frightening' experience after Christine Lampard stalker hell
content: Stephen Nolan has opened up about a terrifying experience that left him feeling 'vulnerable' and 'frightened'.    Discussing Christine Lampard's stalker hell , the TV presenter revealed on his BBC Radio 5 Live show that he also went through something difficult a few years ago.    Stephen explained: "I can share an experience with you. This was quite an extraordinary experience and I haven't talked about it much at all.    "Maybe about 3 years ago... I started getting, on a daily basis, quite abusive phone messages being left on the office phone from a woman who called herself Marie.   Read More   "It then went into what was, at the beginning, quite comical where she went from being nasty to then suggesting on a daily basis that I was her boyfriend and that her and I were in love and what time was I coming home at?    "And then there would be a mother in the background screaming down the phone, while Marie was talking on the answering machine, shouting that I needed to treat her better.      Stephen Nolan   "We would listen to these messages every day in the Nolan office and, you know, it was a little bit funny.   Read More   "It then got to the stage that there were letters coming into the BBC to me most days from this woman who I had never met, never knew, had had no conversation in my life with her and yet she was saying on these messages on the phone, she was living in a world where she was living with me every day and she would listen to the radio every day and then recount what her and I had allegedly done together in any given week.      Christine and Frank Lampard. Photo by William Cherry/Press Eye   "I then drove down to the BBC one morning, got to work about half past 7 and there is this woman, who had flown over from Scotland, now standing at the bonnet of my car screaming at me that her and I had been in this relationship for 10 years, whatever it was, and this was disgraceful that I was treating her like this.   Read More   "Very little frightens me and I got really frightened because I thought to myself, 'where next in this fantasy land?'    "What if this woman picks up the phone to the police and alleges that I had done something? And there was me vulnerable, with this person that I didn't know who had completely got herself into some type of state where reality didn't matter to her, her reality was that her and I were together."      Stephen Nolan  (Image: Nick Garbutt)   Stephen went on to explain that he then received a phone call from a hotel in the week that the woman had flown over from Scotland asking him to settle a bill, after she had managed to convince them that he was her boyfriend.   Read More   The 44-year-old said that it came to the point where he had to get the police involved, and added: "It's hard to imagine unless it has happened to you but it does strike fear into you because you think to yourself, 'I'm vulnerable here, these people could say anything'."  It comes as Co Down TV star Christine Lampard revealed she is terrified to go out alone after facing a stalker hell. Aspiring actor Christof King, 39, faces a possible prison sentence after bombarding the presenter with “strange” letters and turning up at her home unannounced.
